III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Within the past week, a staff member made a youth show their
penis to the staff member.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Client’s Rights Advisor was interviewed face to
face at the facility on 6/7/23 in conjunction with MDHHS
Worker. Complainant reported a note was found in the client’s
rights box on Monday 6/5/23. Complainant reported the client’s
rights box was last checked on Wednesday 5/31/23 so the note
must have been put in the box between 5/31/23-6/5/23. The note
was not completed on a client’s rights form, which means youth
likely did not speak to staff prior to putting the note in the box.
Complainant reported Youth A prefers to be called by the first
name written on the note found in the box, and he is the only
youth at the facility who goes by or legally has that name.
Complainant stated there have been no incident reports involving
Youth A and Supervisor.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 6/7/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CA
stated they’re not sure whether Youth A wrote the note because
typically youth would request a client’s rights form from staff prior
to submitting a grievance, and that process wasn’t followed in this
situation. CA reported Supervisor is on administrative leave
pending the investigation.
Education Specialist was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 6/7/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker.
Education Specialist reported Supervisor never talks to any of the
youth alone, and always pulls in other staff to ensure there is a
witness to the conversations and interactions occurring. Education
Specialist reported after Youth A was interviewed by Consultant
and MDHHS Worker today, he immediately came back to the unit
and reported he felt someone was trying to set him up and was
extremely upset. Education Specialist reported Youth A is
devastated someone wrote his preferred name on the note
submitted. Education Specialist was shown the handwritten note
to see if she could identify the author’s handwriting. Education
Specialist stated the person who wrote the note did not spell
Supervisor’s name correctly. Education Specialist provided the
names of four youth she knew it couldn’t be due to how messy
their handwriting is or how low functioning one youth is.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
6/12/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported
2

none of the youth in Zondervan Home have ever disclosed
anything negative or unsafe about Supervisor. Therapist reported
none of the youth have reported any allegations against her.
Therapist reported if anything, Supervisor has been the saving
grace for the youth and has helped get things moving in their
cases. Therapist reported Supervisor would never do anything to
harm or jeopardize the youth in any way.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
6/12/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she was hurt by the allegations against her. Supervisor
feels these allegations have changed her relationship with the
youth because she feels she’s under scrutiny right now. She
stated she feels she needs to change how she interacts with
them, even though she already felt she had good boundaries with
them. Supervisor reported she has a very genuine relationship
with each of the youth and treats them as if they were her own
youth. Supervisor reported if there is a situation in which she
needs to speak with a youth, she always makes sure to bring
another staff into the conversations, so she is never alone with a
youth. She reported if a youth needs to be patted down, there are
always two staff present doing the pat downs and youth are never
unclothed. Supervisor reported she always ensures a male staff is
present during the pat downs. Supervisor reported the only time
she has ever been alone with a youth is if she was transporting a
youth from Zondervan Home across campus to the Employment
Training Center. Supervisor stated she has never asked a youth to
show her their private parts for any reason. Supervisor could not
think of any youth who she feels would want to get her in trouble.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/7/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he has a
legal name but prefers to go by the first name written on the note
submitted to the client’s rights box. Youth A reported he really
likes Supervisor as she is very caring and loving. Youth A reported
there is nothing he dislikes about her, and she has never done
anything to make him feel uncomfortable or unsafe. Youth A
reported he has never put a note or client’s rights form into the
client’s rights box. During the interview, Youth A was shown the
note and he visibly looked shocked. Youth A’s voice became
louder, and he said, “who wrote this?” Youth A reported it was not
his writing and he did not write the note. Youth A reported he has
no idea who would have written the note. Youth A denied
Supervisor has ever asked him to show her his private parts.
Youth A stated Supervisor doesn’t let female staff complete
contraband checks on youth and when she must speak with
3

youth, she always has another staff member present. Youth A
reported he doesn’t know of any situations where any youth have
felt uncomfortable with Supervisor. Youth A reported if he ever felt
unsafe at the facility, Supervisor would be the first person he
would talk to about it.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/7/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported no staff
have done anything to make him feel uncomfortable or unsafe.
Youth B reported there are no staff he dislikes. Youth B stated he
has not heard about any situations in which other youth felt
uncomfortable or unsafe with staff. During the interview, Youth B
was shown part of the handwritten note. Youth B denied writing
the note or knowing who did. Youth B has not heard of any
situations where youth have been asked to show their private
parts to any staff, including Supervisor. Youth B reported if he
ever felt unsafe on the unit, Supervisor would be the first one he
talked to about it.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/7/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
Supervisor is nice, wants the best for all the youth and holds them
accountable. Youth C reported no female staff do contraband
checks for youth, including Supervisor. He reported he has never
written a note for himself or anyone else to put into the client’s
rights box. During the interview, Youth C was shown part of the
note found in the client’s rights box. Youth C reported he has
never heard of a situation where a staff member asked a youth to
show them their private parts. Youth C reported he does not know
who wrote the note or why it was written. Youth C reported all of
the youth on the unit talk a lot, so he feels he would have already
heard someone bragging about it by now if they wrote it.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/12/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported there is a
lie going around the unit that someone said Supervisor was trying
to see a youth’s private area. Youth D reported Youth C told him
someone wrote a note, but there was no one’s name on the note,
and it was written anonymously. Youth D reported he thinks Youth
F wrote the note because other kids have messy handwriting and
Youth C said it looked like Youth F’s handwriting. Youth D
reported Supervisor would never do anything like the note alleges.
Youth D reported Supervisor is never alone with the youth and
takes boundaries very seriously. Youth D reported Supervisor
always has another staff present when she is meeting with youth.
Youth D reported if Supervisor must go to a youth’s room, she
4

never goes inside the room with a youth alone, and instead stands
in the doorway with the door open.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/12/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported he heard
Supervisor was accused of something but is not sure what the
allegations were or how the allegations came about. Youth E
reported whatever the allegations are, they are false. Youth E
reported all the youth get along with Supervisor and none of the
youth have ever said anything bad about Supervisor. Youth E
reported Supervisor is never alone with youth and male staff
always complete the contraband checks on youth. Youth E
reported Supervisor has never done anything to make him feel
unsafe or uncomfortable. Youth E reported he does not know of
any situations where other youth felt uncomfortable with
Supervisor for any reason.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/12/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth F reported
Supervisor is always kind, always gives grace, is never
disrespectful, and holds youth accountable. Youth F reported he
doesn’t know exactly what the note said but knows Supervisor
would never do anything to hurt anyone. Youth F reported
whatever bad thing is being said about Supervisor is a complete
lie because she’s a good person and treats all the youth well.
Youth F reported Supervisor has never done anything to make
him feel unsafe or uncomfortable. Youth F reported he does not
know of any situations where other youth felt uncomfortable with
Supervisor for any reason.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Handwritten note found in client’s rights box states “Fire
Mama DeDe. She made me show her my private parts!!!”
and has the first name Youth A prefers to be called written
in the top right corner.
• Child Placement Roster dated 6/4/23 shows no youth
residing at the facility have the same first name as written
on the note.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Physical Contact and
Sexuality Procedures (rev. 4/17/18) outlines actions staff
should and should not take when interacting with youth.
The procedures are in place to ensure there are healthy
physical and emotional boundaries between staff and
youth. Staff members are not to be alone in youth’s
5

bedroom. Staff members are to leave doors of other rooms
open when talking alone with youth.
• Supervisor does not have any disciplinary action in her
employee file. Supervisor attended Professional
Boundaries training on 4/7/20, 2/23/21 and 9/26/22.
Supervisor completed Maintaining Professional Boundaries
training on 3/3/22.
Analysis Based on interviews completed and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. Youth A prefers to be called the name
matching the name written on the note found in the client’s rights
box. Youth A denied writing the note or knowing who did. Five
other youth also denied writing the note or knowing who did.
Supervisor denied ever asking a youth to show her their private
parts.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
